The Queen.H.R.H. The Princess Elizabeth.H.R.H. The Princess Margaret Rose.The Prime Minister.The Home Secretary.Mr. Winston Churchill.General Sir Hastings Ismay.The Three War Time Chiefs of Staff, viz. :-Admiral of the Fleet Viscount Cunningham.Field-Marshal Viscount Alanbrooke.Marshal of the Royal Air Force Viscount Portal.The Five Supreme Allied Commanders, viz. : General Eisenhower.Field-Marshal Viscount Wavell.Admiral Lord Louis Mountbatten.Field-Marshal Viscount Alexander.Field-Marshal Lord Maitland-Wilson.(b) It is possible to add a few places for Dominion Premiers if they are inthe United Kingdom at the time.(c) The Prime Minister on behalf of His Majesty's Government will issuepersonal invitations to General Eisenhower, Mr. Winston Churchill, ViscountWavell, Viscount Alexander, and the Dominion Premiers.(d) Suggested layout on the Saluting Base is at Appendix " a."2. Chiefs of Staff and Supreme Allied Commanders.The Chiefs of Staff and Supreme Allied Commanders should take part inthe procession. They will travel along the M.T. route ahead of the M.T. Column,passing through Parliament Square at about 10-30 a.m. and so arrive at theSaluting Base before His Majesty The King.[31557'] 3.
